decks.notes: The deck focuses on playing low-cost, efficient threats and disruption spells to put pressure on the opponent and control the game tempo. By utilizing card draw, graveyard interaction, and cheap removal, the deck aims to maintain a fast pace and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of creatures and burn spells. The key is to deploy threats early, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and close out the game before they can stabilize. Additionally, the deck has a strong mana base to support its color requirements and maximize its potential in aggressive matchups.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent through efficient creatures like Eidolon of the Great Revel, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear, as well as burn spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to maintain a fast pace and apply pressure early on, utilizing cards like Atarka's Command and Boros Charm to buff its creatures and deal additional damage. The mana base is optimized for consistent and fast mana access to ensure the deck can consistently put pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Splinter Twin combo using Deceiver Exarch and Pestermite to create infinite creature tokens that can attack for the win. The deck also includes control elements like Remand, Dispel, and Spell Snare to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. Mana fixing and card draw from cards like Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage help smooth out the deck's draws and maintain card advantage. Blood Moon is included as a disruptive piece against opponent's mana bases, potentially giving the deck an edge in certain matchups.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly drop your own life total to boost the power of Death's Shadow, while utilizing aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Steppe Lynx, and Wild Nacatl to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes spells like Temur Battle Rage, Mutagenic Growth, and Become Immense to pump up your creatures for a big finish. Mishra's Bauble and Gitaxian Probe provide card advantage and help trigger abilities, while Lightning Bolt serves as versatile removal. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and win the game swiftly.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by casting efficient burn spells and playing aggressive creatures. The key strategy is to swarm the board with early creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while using spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to finish off the opponent. By maintaining pressure and staying ahead on the board, this deck aims to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize. The use of efficient creatures and burn spells ensures a fast and aggressive playstyle that overwhelms opponents in a quick, decisive manner.

The deck focuses on efficiently generating storm count through spells like Desperate Ritual, Pyretic Ritual, and Manamorphose to cast a large Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens for the win. Using cards like Goblin Electromancer and Past in Flames to reduce mana costs and recast spells from the graveyard, the deck aims to quickly assemble a high storm count and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells. Cantrips like Gitaxian Probe, Serum Visions, and Sleight of Hand help dig for combo pieces and maintain the flow of the deck.

This deck focuses on using small artifact creatures like Signal Pest, Ornithopter, and Memnite to quickly build up a board presence and then buff them with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of efficient creatures that can quickly deal lethal damage, especially with the help of Arcbound Ravager and Etched Champion. Additionally, the deck utilizes cards like Spellskite and Vault Skirge for protection and lifegain to stay ahead in the race. The lands and artifacts are carefully chosen to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent by utilizing low-cost, efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. The key strategy is to apply constant pressure on the opponent's life total, while disrupting their game plan with direct damage spells and creatures that deal damage whenever spells are cast. The deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible, overwhelming the opponent before they can stabilize their board or gain control of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to efficiently churn through the deck using cantrips and cheap spells to build up counters on Pyromancer Ascension, enabling explosive combos and storming off with a flurry of spells. Noxious Revival provides recursion while Visions of Beyond offers draw power. Lightning Bolt provides removal and Cryptic Command offers versatility. The mana base is designed to support the combo pieces and ensure consistency. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game in a single turn with a high storm count.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through using the powerful UrzaTron lands to ramp into big threats like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. By utilizing cards like Expedition Map and Ancient Stirrings to find the necessary Tron pieces, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like All Is Dust and Platinum Angel while also protecting key permanents with Spellskite. The deck has a strong late-game plan with the ability to generate massive amounts of mana and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

The main concept of this Modern Merfolk deck is to quickly establish a board presence of powerful Merfolk creatures by utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Spreading Seas, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Vapor Snag and Spell Pierce. By buffing up our creatures with Lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident, and creating tokens with Master of Waves, we aim to overwhelm our opponent with a strong aggro strategy that can quickly close out games.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively with powerful creatures and removal spells, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with hand disruption. It aims to control the board by efficiently removing threats and gaining card advantage with cards like Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil. The deck also has a strong midrange game plan with cards like Tarmogoyf and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to finish off the opponent quickly. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and keep the opponent on the back foot with its versatile threats and removal spells.

The main concept of this deck is to combine Splinter Twin with Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create an infinite combo that allows for a sudden win condition. The deck includes cards like Serum Visions and Remand to help set up the combo and protect it from disruption. Additionally, cards like Lightning Bolt and Snapcaster Mage provide additional control and removal options, while utility lands like Desolate Lighthouse and Cavern of Souls offer flexibility in certain matchups. Overall, the deck focuses on assembling the combo quickly and efficiently to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to create a fast and powerful aggressive strategy by bestowing auras onto hexproof creatures like Slippery Bogle, Kor Spiritdancer, and Gladecover Scout. By taking advantage of this synergy, the deck aims to generate large amounts of damage quickly while protecting key creatures from removal spells with cards like Daybreak Coronet and Hyena Umbra. The deck also includes some disruption elements like Mana Tithe and Path to Exile to help maintain tempo and push through the opponent's defenses.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw the entire deck and then win the game with Lightning Storm. It utilizes various tutors and card selection spells to find the combo pieces quickly while also including protection in the form of Pact of Negation and Slaughter Pact. The mana base is designed to support the combo and ensure the deck can function smoothly and consistently. With proper sequencing and timing, the deck can execute its game plan efficiently and potentially win the game in a single turn.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Vault Skirge, Signal Pest, and Arcbound Ravager. By utilizing artifact creatures and artifacts like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer, the deck can quickly pump up its creatures to deal massive amounts of damage. The inclusion of cards like Springleaf Drum and Thoughtcast allows for quick mana acceleration and card draw to keep the pressure on the opponent. The deck's versatility and synergy between its cards make it a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matchups.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through a combination of targeted discard spells, removal spells, and powerful creatures. The deck utilizes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Gifts Ungiven to maximize value and flexibility in its decisions. By efficiently disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Duress, while also presenting threats like Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite and Grave Titan, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents in the long game. The inclusion of cards like Lingering Souls and Thragtusk provides additional resilience and inevitability.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap spells and efficient creatures to put pressure on the opponent and quickly close out the game. By combining burn spells, counterspells, and creatures that generate additional value, the deck aims to keep opponents on the back foot and limit their ability to stabilize. With a mix of disruptive elements and aggressive threats, this deck looks to establish early momentum and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost artifacts to quickly amass a powerful battlefield presence. By equipping creatures with Cranial Plating and buffing them with Steel Overseer, the deck can deliver massive amounts of damage in a short amount of time. The presence of cards like Inkmoth Nexus and Galvanic Blast provides added versatility and reach, ensuring that the pressure remains high throughout the game. The combination of aggressive creatures and artifact synergies makes this deck a formidable force to be reckoned with in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on leveraging efficient removal spells and discard effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying aggressive threats like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze to pressure the opponent's life total. The use of versatile cards like Abrupt Decay and Kolaghan's Command ensures that the deck can handle a variety of threats while keeping the opponent on the back foot. The combination of disruptive elements and powerful threats allows the deck to quickly close out games while keeping the opponent off balance.
